questions.question: Tom has 5 red apples and 3 green apples. His friend Sarah, who is 10 years old, gives him 4 more apples. How many apples does Tom have now?
questions.hint: Add all the apples together. Sarah's age doesn't affect the count!

questions.question: A blue car travels 60 km in 2 hours. The car weighs 1,500 kg. What is the car's speed?
questions.hint: Speed = distance ÷ time. The car's weight doesn't affect the calculation.

questions.question: Emma bought 6 pencils for $2 each. The shop opened at 9 AM and has 3 floors. How much did she spend?
questions.hint: Multiply the number of pencils by the price each. Shop details don't matter.

questions.question: There are 24 students in a class. 8 students wear glasses and 15 brought lunch. How many students don't wear glasses?
questions.hint: Subtract the glasses-wearers from the total. The lunch info is a distraction.

questions.question: A rectangle is 8 cm long and 5 cm wide. It's drawn on yellow paper. What is its perimeter?
questions.hint: Perimeter = 2 × (length + width). Paper color doesn't affect the shape.

questions.question: Jake has 15 marbles. His sister is 7 years old. He gives away 6 marbles. How many does he have left?
questions.hint: Start with what Jake has, subtract what he gives away. Sister's age is irrelevant.

questions.question: A book has 120 pages. The cover is blue and it costs $15. If you read 30 pages per day, how many days to finish?
questions.hint: Divide total pages by pages per day. Cover color and price don't matter.

questions.question: Maria has 3 cats and 2 dogs. She lives on Oak Street and is 12 years old. How many pets does she have?
questions.hint: Add cats and dogs together. Street and age are distractions.

questions.question: A pizza is cut into 8 slices. The pizza is pepperoni flavor and costs $16. If 3 slices are eaten, how many remain?
questions.hint: Start with total slices, subtract eaten slices. Flavor and cost don't matter.

questions.question: Sam runs 4 km each morning. He wears red shoes and starts at 6 AM. How far does he run in 5 days?
questions.hint: Multiply daily distance by number of days. Shoe color and start time are irrelevant.

questions.question: A tree is 12 meters tall. It's an oak tree planted 20 years ago. A bird sits 4 meters from the top. How high is the bird?
questions.hint: Subtract the distance from top from the total height. Tree type and age don't matter.

questions.question: Lisa bought 4 notebooks at $3 each. The store is on Main Street and has 50 employees. How much did she pay?
questions.hint: Multiply quantity by price per item. Store location and employees are distractions.

questions.question: A bus can carry 40 passengers. The bus is yellow and the driver's name is Bob. If 28 people are on board, how many empty seats?
questions.hint: Subtract current passengers from capacity. Color and driver's name don't matter.

questions.question: Ben has $25. He earns $10 mowing lawns on Saturday. His birthday is in March. How much money does he have now?
questions.hint: Add what he earns to what he had. Birthday month is irrelevant.

questions.question: A garden has 6 rows of flowers with 8 flowers in each row. The flowers are tulips and bloom in spring. How many flowers total?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by flowers per row. Flower type and season don't affect the count.

questions.question: Amy walked 2 km to school and 2 km back. She wore her blue backpack and met 5 friends. How far did she walk in total?
questions.hint: Add the distance there and back. Backpack color and friends are distractions.

questions.question: A movie is 90 minutes long. It stars Tom Hanks and was released in 2020. If you've watched 35 minutes, how much is left?
questions.hint: Subtract watched time from total time. Actor and release year don't matter.

questions.question: Peter has 18 toy cars. 6 are red, 7 are blue, and the rest are green. His room is on the second floor. How many green cars?
questions.hint: Total minus red minus blue equals green. Room location is irrelevant.

questions.question: A cake weighs 2 kg. It's chocolate flavored and was baked by grandma. If it's cut into 8 equal pieces, how much does each weigh?
questions.hint: Divide total weight by number of pieces. Convert kg to g if needed. Flavor and baker don't matter.

questions.question: There are 30 birds in a tree. The tree is in Central Park and is 50 years old. If 12 birds fly away, how many remain?
questions.hint: Subtract birds that leave from the starting count. Location and tree age are distractions.

questions.question: Kate reads 15 pages per hour. Her favorite author is J.K. Rowling. How many pages can she read in 3 hours?
questions.hint: Multiply pages per hour by number of hours. Favorite author doesn't affect speed.

questions.question: A box contains 36 chocolates. The box is square and has a red ribbon. If 4 children share equally, how many each?
questions.hint: Divide total chocolates by number of children. Box shape and ribbon are irrelevant.

questions.question: David's fish tank holds 50 liters. The tank is glass and sits near the window. He adds 12 liters of water. It had 30 liters. How full now?
questions.hint: Add the new water to what was already there. Material and location don't matter.

questions.question: A train has 8 carriages with 45 seats each. The train is blue and travels at 120 km/h. How many seats total?
questions.hint: Multiply carriages by seats per carriage. Color and speed are distractions.

questions.question: Sophie scored 85 on her math test and 90 on science. Her teacher's name is Mrs. Smith. What's her total score?
questions.hint: Add the two test scores together. Teacher's name is irrelevant.

questions.question: A pool is 25 m long. The water temperature is 28°C. Tom swims 4 lengths. How far did he swim?
questions.hint: Multiply pool length by number of lengths. Water temperature doesn't affect distance.

questions.question: Lucy has 24 stickers. She got them at a party on Saturday. She gives 8 to her friend. How many does she have left?
questions.hint: Start with total, subtract what she gives away. When/where she got them doesn't matter.

questions.question: A square has sides of 7 cm. It's drawn in black ink on white paper. What is its area?
questions.hint: Area of square = side × side. Ink and paper colors are distractions.

questions.question: Mike bought 5 apples at 60 cents each. The apples are from California and are organic. How much did he spend?
questions.hint: Multiply quantity by price each. Origin and organic status don't affect cost.

questions.question: A class has 32 students. 14 are boys. The classroom is Room 204 on the first floor. How many are girls?
questions.hint: Total students minus boys equals girls. Room number and floor are irrelevant.

questions.question: A rope is 15 m long. It's made of nylon and is blue. If you cut off 6 m, how long is the remaining piece?
questions.hint: Subtract the cut length from the total. Material and color don't matter.

questions.question: Jenny baked 24 cookies. The oven was set to 180°C. She gives 9 to neighbors. How many cookies does she have?
questions.hint: Start with total baked, subtract what she gives away. Oven temperature is irrelevant.

questions.question: A bag holds 20 candies. The bag is plastic and from the corner store. If Tom takes 7 candies, how many are left?
questions.hint: Total minus taken equals remaining. Bag material and store don't matter.

questions.question: Dad drives 45 km to work. His car is silver and he leaves at 7:30 AM. How far does he drive for a round trip?
questions.hint: Round trip means there and back - multiply one-way by 2. Car color and time are distractions.

questions.question: A shelf has 4 rows of books with 9 books per row. The shelf is wooden and brown. How many books total?
questions.hint: Multiply rows by books per row. Material and color are irrelevant.

questions.question: Sara has 50 beads. Her favorite color is purple. She uses 18 beads for a bracelet. How many beads are left?
questions.hint: Start with total, subtract what she uses. Favorite color doesn't affect the count.

questions.question: A bicycle costs $150. The bike is from Japan and has 21 gears. If Mark saves $25 per week, how many weeks to buy it?
questions.hint: Divide total cost by weekly savings. Origin and gears don't affect the calculation.

questions.question: A box weighs 8 kg. The box is cardboard and was shipped on Monday. If you have 3 boxes, what's the total weight?
questions.hint: Multiply weight per box by number of boxes. Material and shipping day are distractions.

questions.question: There are 60 minutes in an hour. Clocks can be digital or analog. How many minutes in 4 hours?
questions.hint: Multiply minutes per hour by number of hours. Clock types are irrelevant.

questions.question: Anna plants 5 seeds per pot. She uses brown pots from the garden center. If she has 7 pots, how many seeds does she need?
questions.hint: Multiply seeds per pot by number of pots. Pot color and source don't matter.
